column2: ENGLISH
Sometimes I look at myself in the ripples of the water, or comments are made by my friends or rivals about my strength. Sometimes I feel as if their comments ring true...
I am...
I am strong!
I am Fit!
I think I am weak...
I am average, I guess.
Others have been making comments about my ward and their strength...
They are...
They say they are strong for their age.
They say they are unusually athletic.
They claim they are a little weak...
They say they are average for their age.
More Options!

A player has asked to swear fealty, but is a King themselves. If you wish to take them as a vassal, you must have an Empire-tier title. To deal with this, accepting will create an Empire Tier title based on your primary title and automatically vassalise them.
This union would be in my interest.
I refuse!
The Andal Invasion

In the Riverlands the horns sound as nine Kings lead their hosts to war. In the North the noble house Stark continues to expand their borders and influence. In the West, the dominance of the Rock is now challenged by the emergence of new kingdoms in the Golden Hills. To the South, the Marshals and High King of the Reach continue their policy of internal squabbling whilst being raided by Andals and Dornish alike. In the Vale a young bronzeman raises his banners against the young fool of a falcon. One thing is for certain however, the final battle between the now two peoples of Westeros draws ever nearer...

For thousands of years the walls and swords of the southern lordlings have kept the tide of our people at bay. Yet their time comes to an end soon. We will scale their wall of ice, we will sack their houses of stone, we will take their women as our own. This we shall do in the coming years. We are the Free Folk, the oldest and strongest of the peoples of this accursed continent.

With the death of Iron King Harras, a new King worthy of the seastone chair was to be elected. The Lord-Reavers and Lesser-Lords of the Kingdom of Salt and Rock met upon the plains of Orkmont to decide this royal question. Yet, none of the candidates could gain enough votes. Among them were Harrag Hoare, Victarion Harlaw, Dunstan Drumm, and Gormond Goodbrother. All were equally capable of leading the Ironborn to many great victories, and so Harrag proposed that they should all rule as Kings, and their allies should become their vassals, and they would engage in warfare until the Drowned God chose the rightful successor of his domain, and so it was decided.... What is dead may never die, but rises again, harder and stronger.

Night gathers, and now my watch begins. It shall not end until my death. I shall take no wife, hold no lands, father no children. I shall wear no crowns and win no glory. I shall live and die at my post. I am the sword in the darkness. I am the watcher on the walls. I am the fire that burns against the cold, the light that brings the dawn, the horn that wakes the sleepers, the shield that guards the realms of men. I pledge my life and honor to the Night's Watch, for this night and all the nights to come.

The domination of the Valyrian Freehold in western Essos is ensured. The Viceroy dictates his servants from the Silver Palace of Lys, one of the grandest cities in the known world. The Freehold will never fall in our lifetimes that is for certain. Slaves from all over the world mine in the endless chasms of Valyria. Its influence can be felt as far as Blackwater Bay and beyond. All is done under the eyes and shadow of the dragon. Thousands of Valyrians flood into the western territories to begin its colonization. The wizards from the fourteen flames tell of a Golden Age that is set to begin soon for the Valyrians. Kesi undegon ia qeldlie jeda.
It will be an age of bloodshed...
Infrastructure & Roads

TSK features a custom building system, built around an upgradeable provincial infrastructure & roads. From the beginning of the game infrastructure is handed out to provinces - based on the region the province is based in and further influenced by the rank of the holder. So in most cases, you'll encounter a blocker when upgrading buildings - infrastructure. Infrastructure can be upgraded by right clicking on the capital holding in a province, with up to five levels possible. Do be warned that infrastructure has upkeep, and it isn't a great idea to upgrade it all at once.
And so the world shall be built anew!
I accept your humble request to become a Knight, go forth and serve the Seven Pointed star with honor and virtue.
I offer my services to the most holy Seven.
No, you do not deserve a Knighthood.
Alas!
DEBUG: DUEL OPPONENT SUCCESSFULLY FLED
DEBUG: DUEL OPPONENT FAILED TO FLEE
DEBUG: DUEL OPPONENT DID NOT TRY TO FLEE
Dammit.
Let us test [From.GetHerHis] Mettle.
DEBUG: VICTORIOUS, OPPONENT KILLED
DEBUG: VICTORIOUS, OPPONENT INJURED
DEBUG: DRAW, INCONCLUSIVE RESULTS
DEBUG: DRAW, OPPONENT WOUNDED
DEBGU: DRAW, SELF WOUNDED
DEBUG: DRAW, BOTH WOUNDED
DEBUG: DRAW, OPPONENT KILLED
DEBUG: DRAW, SELF WOUNDED OPPONENT KILLED
DEBUG: DEFEAT, SELF WOUNDED
DEBUG: KILLED DURING DUEL
PER: INITIAL EVENT, CHOOSE TO ENGAGE OR DISENGAGE
VIC: VICTIM EVENT, CHOOSE FIGHT OR FLIGHT

PER: EVT3, REFLECT VIC FIGHT OR FLIGHT - Something isn't right with this event. This should be a generated description based on the outcome of the event. [From.GetFirstName] is the opponent. If there is a blank, the scope is broken.

VIC: EVT4, CALCULATE RESULTS - Something isn't right with this event. This should be a generated description based on the outcome of the event. [From.GetFirstName] is the opponent. If there is a blank, the scope is broken.

PER: EVT5, CALCULATE RESULTS - Something isn't right with this event. This should be a generated description based on the outcome of the event. [From.GetFirstName] is the opponent. If there is a blank, the scope is broken.

You find yourself standing amidst your men, the eb and flow of battle pulsating around you. Weapons clash and men scream around you. Then, just ahead of you catch sight of a face you recognize - the enemy commander, [From.GetFirstName]! The advantage is yours - slip behind your men, or charge [From.GetHerHim] with your blade held high!
Charge [From.GetHerHim]!
Slip behind your lines...
You catch sight of [From.GetFirstName] as they charge at you in a flash. With only a few moments to spare, you decide...
To fight
To try and flee!
As you stumble on the corpses of the dead and dying, the gap between you and [From.GetFirstName] begins to grow greater, and in moment your target is lost as they disappear into the chaos.

[From.GetFirstName] stumbles and falls upon a blanket of death as they try to flee from you, but in moments it becomes clear that you are soon to be upon them - and so they desperately ready their arms to take you.
[From.GetFirstName] catches sight of you, and begins to move towards you, intent on meeting your challenge.
So be it.
[From.GetSheHe] charged at me. Although blows were exchanged, I realized I had made a mistake when the world started spinning. Broken and bloody, I am sure not to last much longer...
And so [From.GetSheHe] struck that last blow. Your legs gave way beneath you, and you joined the tide of corpses beneath you.
Our weapons did clash time and time again, but there was nothing we could do to best one another. [From.GetFirstName] is as much my match as I am theirs.
[From.GetFirstName] did not stand a chance before me, and after many swift blows from my weapon did I fell them. Although they still breath, I doubt they will ever risk to challenge me again.
So be it.
Arrrrgh!
[From.GetSheHe] charged at me. Although blows were exchanged, I realized I had made a mistake when the world started spinning. Broken and bloody, I am sure not to last much longer...
And so [From.GetSheHe] struck that last blow. Your legs gave way beneath you, and you joined the tide of corpses beneath you.
Our weapons did clash time and time again, but there was nothing we could do to best one another. [From.GetFirstName] is as much my match as I am theirs.
Chance smiled upon me, for it seemed I would never best [From.GetFirstName], let alone they I. Although I am could hardly call myself luck or that duel heroic, at least I am still breathing.

[From.GetFirstName] did not stand a chance before me, and with a swift blow my weapon did fell them. It is clear as day that they shall never walk, talk or even laugh again. The worms will rule over them now.
[From.GetFirstName] did not stand a chance before me, and after many swift blows from my weapon did I fell them. Although they still breath, I doubt they will ever risk to challenge me again.
So be it.
Arrrrrrgh!
Ser
Ser
Lady
Lady

The greatsword Dawn was forged from the heart of this fallen star. Throughout time only the greatest of warriors of House Dayne can claim and wield this magical sword. It is said that the sword contains magical quantities that makes its wielder an even better warrior. You now claim the sword Dawn and will forever be known in history as [Root.GetTitledFirstName] 'The Sword Of The Morning' [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName].
I shall fight with honor!

According to legend, Samwell 'Starsmith' the founder of House Dayne tracked a falling star to the mouth of the Torentine. The greatsword Dawn was forged from the heart of this fallen star. Throughout time only the greatest of warriors of House Dayne can claim and wield this magical sword. The Sword Of The Morning rises again and already is praised for their honor and chivalry.
I wish you good fortune in the wars to come.
Sword of the Morning or not, filthy dornish men, all are liars.

A priest of [missionary_religion_from.Religion.GetName] faith and their retinue has turned up at your doorstep, requesting an audience with you. You could invite them in, placing them either at your mercy or in a position to discuss whatever it is they wish to discuss, or outright turn them away.
Turn the priest away!
Invite them in...

Once invited in, the priest and their men lower their guard, but do not settle. It quickly becomes clear that they do not intend to linger, and are here for one reason - to convert you to their faith. An offer is made and a silence hangs as they await your response.
Accept their offer and convert to [missionary_religion_from.Religion.GetName].
Politely decline their offer and see them out.
Have the priest and his men killed.
The priest has returned with a large number of armed men, likely raised from a nearby population center. They make only one demand - your conversion. The alternative is clear.
Concede to them and accept their demands.
Take on the challenge and fight them in the name of [Root.Religion.GetName]
Perhaps there is another way?

The [missionary_religion_from.Religion.GetName] priest has returned with even more armed men, having put the bribe to good use. They no longer have interest in conversion and have already begun to construct a camp outside of your holding.
So be it.
Locals have risen up, attacking our people!
So be it.

With the Bronzemen hosts scattered I must now travel to Runestone to secure the formal submission of the traitors. During the two days of traveling a host of loyal knights arrived to join us.\n\n As you lay in bed preparing to sleep for the night you hear the distinct sound of a sword being unsheathed and the eventual clash of swords. The guards outside your tent are cut down before your eyes, you attempt to reach your sword, but you're too late. You feel the blade enter and exit your stomach. The last words you can make out before dying are "None alive--- Roland wishes none to know---."
Damn him!

With the timely death of my father I must now stabilize the realm. I could gain prestige and renown by invading the Riverlands, this would allow me to prove to my vassals that I am a worthy King, or I could stay within the safety of the Vale and consolidate my power.
Darry will fall!
I'd prefer to stay safe.
With House Darry defeated I now control all the land outside the immediate entrance of the Bloody Gate. It will act as a buffer to thwart future invasions.
I have no need of this title.

King Osric grovels at your feet, attempting to explain his actions. Asking, what you would have done to protect your child. It is time to jude King Osric and his children. The Bronzemen do not forget.
I shall have the Kings head, and send knights to secure the Eyrie.
The King will die, I will send an emissary to the Eyrie and offer Roland a choice.
Andar Royce has demanded that you turn yourself over to his Knights and face justice. The Eyrie is to be seized, if you attempt to fight you will be considered an enemy of the realm.
I will turn myself in and surrender the Eyrie.
I will make a stand! (Your guards seize you and slit your throat)
The fool Roland Arryn has seized the Kingdom of Darry. I will bring my hammer south and re-conquer what was lost and avenge my kin.
The Hammer shall fall on Roland.
Your faith has changed, and with that change you have fallen from your knighthood - although you remain a Ser, you are but a hedge knight, existing beyond the established laws of the Knight.
Curses!

Out on a stroll in the nearby farmland, you encounter a strange, entrancing melody, following the source of the sound, you come across an old, blind bard, playing his harp with a grace akin to the gods themselves.
Stand by and listen
Mind if I join you?
You start declaiming poetry\n

The lake is placid as you throw your rope into the water, you let the soft singing of the birds lull you into deep thoughts as you daydream on its banks. Suddenly, the rope stirs and you are pulled into the water. Opening your eyes in the water shows a dark form swiftly swimming towards you.
Stay and Fight
Run Away!

Unable to sleep, you take a walk in the castle gardens. Suddenly, you see a dark form near a small stream. It seems to be a man, wearing a robe as black as death, and washing some bloody rags, as you try to see him more clearly, he raises his head and lets go a melodious, soul wrenching scream. By the time you blink your eyes, he has disappeared.
It's the Stranger!
Pah, spirits don't scare me.

The fresh sea air fills your lungs as you look over the wild waters of the bay, you notice a strange ship, sailing in the distance. Its making is ancient and it never seems to approach the land, only slipping in and out of the fog like a spirit on the doorway.
The ship of the Grey King!.

You feel terribly ill, as if on the brink of death. You have heard rumors of a group of mystics on the island of God's Eye who continue to practice their old ways. These mystics may have forgotten knowledge on how to cure your illness.
Maybe these mystics can cure me
You travel to the island\n
Don't these barbarians also collect the heads of their enemies?
You ignore the rumors\n

As you arrive on the island, you begin to search for the rumored healers. Suddenly, someone grabs you and demands to know why you are here. After you explain your predicament, the man informs you that you that you can only be cured of your ailment if you worship their gods.
So, your gods can perform miracles? Let's get started then.
I refuse to accept your false gods!
After several days of rest, you feel much better, and have begun to worship the islander's gods as your own. As you travel back home, you learn to accept your new faith as the one true faith
Their gods are now my gods
The magic of the Children of the Forest has healed you\n
While traveling along a road you see an old warrior practicing in an open field. He obviously has seen many battles and slain countless foes.
Most likely a robber anyway
You ignore him
Approach him
You ask him for advice
Reports of a new discovery have reached your ears. A large vein of gold and silver has been discovered, this bodes well for the finances of your coffers.
Wonderful!
Your lands have been blessed with constant sunshine and moderate rain showers. These are the signs of a truly bountiful harvest to come.
Fantastic!
Your castellan has taken notice of a large influx of trade into your ports. Large sums of gold generated by services and tariffs have been deposited into your treasury.
Great News!

A large party of Mountain Clansmen have been reported to be near the Gates of the Moon. Your marshal suggests you ride forth to dispatch the barbarians. Your spymaster warns of possible danger to your body.
Assemble the Knights!
You ride forth to hunt them down
I think I'll stay here...

Your column of knights and servants have been traveling for well on five days now. Of the five outriders you sent forward the day before, only one has arrived to tell you of clansmen activity to the south. Without any warning three men run out into the road and hew a knight that sits upon his horse, two more fall as arrows begin to pour in from the thickets surrounding the road.
Ambush!
Attempt to gather your men and carve a bloody path to safety

Countless bodies lay at your feet. The screams of the dying echo in your ears. Limbs are strewn across the blood soaked battlefield. Many of your fellow knights have fallen, this victory will be celebrated from Strongsong to Gulltown.
At least I am alive
Was it worth it?

During the confusion of the battle you are cut off from your men and surrounded by clansmen. You feebly counter attack after attack, you can feel yourself becoming fatigued. One of your assailants raises his axe to strike you.
Argh!
My family will remember me as a martyr
As you walk along the streets you stumble and fall on an uneven surface.
Ouch
I better be more careful
During the week you've been spending more time on the battlements chatting with the watchmen and men at arms. How can these men bare this honest work?
It is their duty
Attempt to be more just
I can't be bothered!
That's very arbitrary of you!
I've been reading ledgers for well over three hours now. My eyes and body could use a rest, perhaps I should head out somewhere?
I'll go to the local tavern
I must stay focused
You arrive at the tavern to the sight of countless men drinking and laughing. You can overhear tales of absolute wonder. The smell of fresh ale and beer is intoxicating.
I'll have a mug of your best mead!
So much noise!
Leave the tavern
You're been consuming mug after mug of the finest ale you've ever tasted, the noise seems to be increasing, everything seems to be spinning. A fine lady asks you to dance, and afterwards...
I don't feel good
You pass out

When you finally awake you've been stripped of most of your clothes and valuables, you slowly walk back to the keep. Luckily most of the citizens don't recognize you, but you do hear many snickers along the way.
The shame!
How embarrassing
Following your conquest of the Goldengrove you must now decide what to do with the de-jure Kingship of the kingdom.
I will suffer no other kings
They may retain their royal style
To Plant a Weirwood

A blanket of clouds hung high in the reddening sky, blotting out the last dregs of light, when a guard approached you about an unexpected visitor. A Greenseer from deep in the wilderness comes with a gift - a Weir seed. You could take the seed from them as a prize, accept their offer and plant it or can simply turn them away.
Accept their gift and arrange for the seed to be planted.
Take the seed from them - it is a trophy well deserved.
Turn them away.
To Plant a Weirwood

You watch the darkness begins to recede with the rising sun with your entourage, waiting upon the Greenseer. Before you they work to plant the seed, digging at the ground with their bare hands. Before long a small mound of dirt forms besides a pit the size of a bowl and in it the seer places the seed. But they are not done, and make a request. Blood is required to activate the seed.
Draw blood from your oldest child.
Draw blood from your own hand.
Sacrifice your youngest child.
Sacrifce a random courtier.
To Plant a Weirwood

Blood coats the seed and soaks into the earth - although you cannot put your finger on it, you sense a change in the seed. However, the seer kicks aside the dirt before you can take a closer look, concealing it under the soil. They say nothing, simply turning away. You wonder what will become of this seed...
Time will tell.
To Plant a Weirwood

Although a year has passed, much has changed. The tree did not only sprout, but it shot up into the sky. The tree is huge, among the largest you have ever seen. A face of terror has been carved into the white bark, and the wood is malformed, as if covered with tumors. It will undoubtedly be held with awe by generations to come.
Perhaps this is a sign of the Old Gods?
To Plant a Weirwood
Although a year has passed, much has changed. The tree spouted and grew rapidly. It bears the bloody face of the Weir, carved into the white bark of its trunk, with an almost serene expression.
There is something peaceful about it.
To Plant a Weirwood

Although a year has passed, not much has changed. The tree spouted and grew rapidly, as far as trees go, but is small and stunted. A face the size of a fist has been carved into the white bark of its trunk, bearing an almost solemn expression.
Do the gods not favor my house?
Traveling
This character is currently away from home, traveling for business or pleasure
Prepare for some traveling
Survey Realm
Travel around the realm and see how it is doing
Claim the Valyrian Freehold
Receive a weak claim on the Valyrian Freehold.
Employ an Eunuch
Promote one of your eunuch servants to one of your courtiers.
column3: Promote one of your eunuch servants to one of your courtiers.
column4: Promote one of your eunuch servants to one of your courtiers.
column6: Promote one of your eunuch servants to one of your courtiers.

column2: Change Primary Wife
Change your primary wife if you don't like your current one.
column3: Change your primary wife if you don't like your current one.
column4: Change your primary wife if you don't like your current one.
column6: Change your primary wife if you don't like your current one.

column2: Perform a Great Sacrifice to [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]
column3: Perform a Great Sacrifice to the Gods
column4: Perform a Great Sacrifice to the Gods
column6: Perform a Great Sacrifice to the Gods

column2: Offer a sacrifice to [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] in a days-long ceremony, in the hope of receiving great blessings from [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
column3: Offer a sacrifice to the deities in a days-long ceremony, in the hope of receiving great blessings from the gods.
column4: Offer a sacrifice to the deities in a days-long ceremony, in the hope of receiving great blessings from the gods.
column6: Offer a sacrifice to the deities in a days-long ceremony, in the hope of receiving great blessings from the gods.

column2: Let us perform the proper ceremonies and rituals!
column3: Let us perform the proper ceremonies and rituals!
column4: Let us perform the proper ceremonies and rituals!
column6: Let us perform the proper ceremonies and rituals!

column2: Take a Concubine
Take a concubine for whatever purposes
Never adopted local Old Gods beliefs before (i.e. can only do once in a lifetime)
Adopt Local Old Gods Beliefs
You currently worship different spirits and deities than the ones that reside in your realm. Perhaps it's time to placate and appease these local spirits and deities instead.
Adopt a Child
Since you don't have any heirs, you can adopt an orphaned noble child as your own.
Hasn't surveyed realm recently
Messengers come to you in the midst of your tour of the realm, warning you that alarming developments have transpired while you were away - you are now at war!
We must hurry and finish this tour of the realm.

It’s been many years since I’ve surveyed my realm. Undoubtedly things have changed since then, and some of my courtiers suggest this would be a good time to travel the land once more and see how my realm is doing.
I’ll think about it.

After deliberation with your advisors and family, you have decided to survey your realm. The preparations will take several days, but the experience will be worth it. After all, it is one thing to hear of how your realm is doing, but another to see it with your own eyes.
I cannot wait.
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] makes preparations for the journey.

Readying your horses, carriages, and entourage, you leave your residence early in the morning. You will probably be gone for a month or so as you try to learn more about your realm. What do the nobles do when youï¾’re not around? How are the commoners surviving? Which regions prosper, and which languish?
So many things to find out!
You are about half-way through your survey of the realm.
Onward! We still have more traveling.
Your survey of the realm is almost complete. There is only a little bit more traveling to do. It might be a good time to reflect on everything that has happened.
Indeed.

Your survey of the realm is coming to a close, and you are almost home. The sight of your residence in the far distance is a welcoming sight, indeed. Nevertheless, you have learned much from your journey, and hopefully these lessons will serve you well in the coming years.
Still, there’s no place like home.

While traveling, you happening upon a strange merchant from the far east who calls himself “Qi Ma the Liar.” Insisting on speaking in the third person, he greets you while twirling his cat-like whiskers: “Qi Ma knows much, tells some. Qi Ma knows many things others do not.”
I’m bored. Let’s see what this eccentric fellow knows.
I shouldn’t associate myself with strange references.

Qi Ma says, “So many Andal kings kill their firstborn sons. Some say because he is not as intelligent as the second son. Some say because he is not as strong as the third son. Some say the daughter will make a better heir. Qi Ma is glad his parents loved him no matter what.”
Um... I think my parents loved me too.
Qi Ma says, “Qi Ma loves Westeros and the Free Cities. Many interesting events that happen to them. Much more than in Yi Ti.”
I sense deja vu.
Wait, didn’t this already happen?

Qi Ma says, “Qi Ma has heard that people of Dorne are too dark, people of North are too ugly, and people of Westeros and the Free Cities all look the same and boring. He has no opinion on the matter. All people are beautiful to him.”
Definitely.
No. Some are better than others!
Qi Ma says, "Qi Ma always sees Valyrian nobles playing chess in their spare time. He thinks they have nothing better to do when they aren’t plotting against each other."
Interesting observation.
We Valyrians just love our chess.
That’s why the Valyrian Freehold was overrun by its enemies?

Qi Ma says, “Some do not know, but the Most Devout is open-minded on some things more than others. Qi Ma has heard that the Septons will elect a follower of R'hllor or a Dothraki warrior as High Septon if they accept having no name!”
Well, that’s ridiculous.
While traveling in the countryside, your entourage discovers a seemingly abandoned bandit camp. Curious, you explore the camp, only to be immediately ambushed by bandits!
Let’s fight these cowards!
Run away! Retreat!

You and your entourage comes across a horrific scene while patrolling some of the nearby roads: an entire caravan of merchants, massacred, possibly by bandits, business rivals, thieves, who knows what! Some of your men suggest you loot all their belongings.
Why not? They won’t need their belongings in the afterlife.
No. We should give them a proper burial.
A small band of robbers foolishly attacked me while I was surveying my realm! My bodyguards easily defeated them, and the survivors are now at my mercy.
Release and make them vow to find honest jobs.
Imprison them.
Execute them on the spot!

I and my party come across the skeleton, half-buried in the mud, its hand still clinging onto a sword. This dead man must have bravely fought to the death before meeting an unfortunate end. Perhaps we should give him a proper burial?
Let’s give him a proper burial, first.
Pray for his soul and move on.
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] and [Root.GetHerHis] bury the skeleton and then set up camp for the night.

Saddened that such a man did not receive a proper burial, you decide to properly bury the skeleton yourself. That night, the ghost of the fallen man comes to you in a dream. Thanking for your kindness, he tells you of a small treasure he buried, and its location.
So... he said walk five hundred steps to the north...
It would be dishonorable to steal such a treasure.

While surveying the realm, you stay at a small outpost one night. However, you can’t help notice how it is falling into disrepair. Discussing the matter with the outpostï¾’s commander, you learn the outpost doesnï¾’t have the funds for a renovation.
How unfortunate.
Give the outpost some funds from your treasury.
Bring in expert builders and resources from afar.
You have come to one of the larger settlements in your realm. Tired from all your traveling, you decide to visit the city’s pleasure quarters.
To the whorehouse!
I’ll just get a drink.
A walk and fresh air is enough.
I should go pray at the local church instead.
I should go pray at the local mosque instead.
I should go pray at the local temple instead.

Tonight I am staying in one of the fortresses of my realm. It is a mighty fortress, built with the sturdiest wood and toughest stone, yet to your horror you learn that the warriors guarding this fort are horridly incompetent and untrained - they can’t even hold their swords and spears the right way!
Give funds to assist these soldiers.
Bring soldiers and supplies from elsewhere to help.
I should help train these fellows myself!

Your journey through your realm continues. Up ahead, you spot a dirty, impoverished village. Although it is almost night time, and you must find a place to rest, a member of your entourage suggests you move on. “After all, we shouldnï¾’t mingle with these disgusting peasants.ï¾”
Dirty or not, we’ll rest here tonight.
Let’s leave this stinkhole!
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] rests in the village for the night.

Your stay at the impoverished village was worse than you imagined - all the mud, insects, manure, and unidentifiable substances! However, the villagers, honored by your presence, decide to present you with small gifts as you are about to leave.
Refuse it - they need it more than me.
Thank you very much.
I demand more!
Let’s give them some of our belongings instead.
Today I am visiting a holy site in my realm. I’ve just arrived, and someone should be showing me around this place sometime soon...
Pray for a while.
Pray all day long.
Offer donations.
Let’s move on, who cares about this nonsense.

Today I am stopping by one of my vassalï¾’s residences. However, the food prepared doesnï¾’t taste that good, to be honest. I almost vomited, but managed to trick my host into thinking I was choking on something.
Thank you for the great food!
This ‘food’ tastes worse than manure.
Iï¾’ll help them find better food supplies.
I don’t mind the taste. It’s just... different.

While traveling in the forest, you come across a lost child. Crying, the little girl says she was playing with her friends in the forest when she got lost, and she hasn’t been home in several days. After giving her a bit of food, she tells you that she lives in a nearby settlement.
Leave her. She deserves it.
Let’s help the poor child find her way back.
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] and [Root.GetHerHis] entourage escort the little girl back to town.

You escort the little girl back to a nearby city, and learn that her father is in fact one of the wealthiest merchants in the city. Crying tears of joy, the merchant tightly embraces his daughter, before offering you a great reward for finding his little girl.
No need for the reward, I’m only doing my duty.
Why thank you, I am such a good person.
Don’t worry about it, my children are crazy too.
While staying at one of the local holdings, I’ve met a talented guard captain. He is quite capable in military matters, despite being of low birth.
Impressive. You set an example for us all.
Why don’t you come to my court?

While traveling, your entourage comes across what at first appear to be soldiers of your realm. After talking with them for a while, you realize they are bandits masquerading as your own soldiers! Where could they have stolen their disguises?
Arrest them!

Today I am resting at one of my realm’s cities. Sitting near the window, I can hear the many conversations townspeople are having outside - the gossip, the rumors, the fears, the hopes, the anger, the happiness, the sadness... There are so many interesting things they say to each other!
Did you know one of the guards used to be an adventurer...

Today I am resting at one of my realm’s villages. Sitting near the window, I can hear the many conversations peasants are having outside. Frankly, though, it’s a little hard to understand the peasants, given they are uneducated and can’t express themselves well, but it’s educational nevertheless.
Someone saw a crab in the mud the other day, horrible creature.

Today while my entourage and I stopped in one of my realm’s villages, one of the inhabitants ran up to me. He whispered to you how he needed your help, how everybody in the village was conspiring against him. “Come meet midnight behind that building there,” he says. “I’ll tell more. We must not be seen!”
Ignore the madman and move on.
Well, I don’t see what harm can come of this.
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] meets the town eccentric behind the large building at night.

As the day progressed, you asked the villagers about this madman. They say he’s just the town eccentric, a harmless fool. Nevertheless, when you meet him at midnight, he insists that the villagers are about to kill him. Taking out a large axe, he requests you give him permission to kill them all.
Guards! Arrest him! Now!
Ah, let him be, he looks harmless.

While on the road, you come across a traveling merchant who specializes in exotic sweets and delicacies from other lands. Currently he is selling off some of his baklava - syrupy pastries from the Free Cities - and offers you some at a discount.
I’ll buy some. What is this baklava stuff, anyways?
I’ll buy some. Baklava is great!
I’ll try one or two.
No, I’m not interested.

Today I am traveling alongside some farmland. Suddenly, I come across a handsome city boy harassing a pretty peasant girl. Apparently it seems like this fool is trying too hard to win the affections of this girl. Perhaps I should intervene in this amusing scene.
You, boy, stop harassing that girl!
You, boy - learn how to woo a lady properly.
They remind me of my younger self.
Bring the pretty girl to my camp tonight whether she likes it or not.
Bring the handsome boy to my camp tonight whether he likes it or not.
As I travel on the road today, Iï¾’ve come across a wandering musician. He says he can play me a good song if I spare him a coin or two.
Bah, who wants to hear your noise?
Sure, sure - sing, my good man.
Listen to the musician sing.
The musician’s song is beautiful indeed, an epic, lyrical tale of heroes and villains, love and war, and too many other things to name.
Thank you!

Having traveled for several days, you come across a large estate. Hundreds of peasants are out in the fields, working hard to ensure the crops are taken care of in a proper manner. It is quite a wonder to see where all your food comes from.
This is the glory of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] at work.
An amazing testament of the power of men.
Qi Ma says, “Ironborn are so serious about beards. So many beards. Qi Ma thinks they wish they had glorious beards like the Valyrians.”
Who knows?
Qi Ma says, “Some say the Dusklanders are invincible. Some say Qi Ma is a liar. Don’t you believe either of those things.”
Well…

Qi Ma says, “Some people think there can only be one empire called the Empire of Ghis. Others say there should only be two or three empires. Yet others say empires can be anywhere. Qi Ma thinks this is silly. Everybody knows the only empire in the world is Yi Ti!”
I see...
Qi Ma says, “Qi Ma has heard it is dangerous to be the brother of a Dothraki Khal because their subjects hate rulers who have too many brothers, nephews, cousins, or uncles!”
It is unusual indeed.
Hey, I like it that way!
Qi Ma says, “Qi Ma's father was also called Qi Ma. As was Qi Ma's father's father. At least, that's what his father said.”
What about your father’s father’s father?

Today we just left a small and quaint town, and are now about to cross a small stream. I decide to rest for a bit near this stream, which locals say has healing properties. After drinking some water from it, I suddenly feel refreshed. It’s as if I had just awakened from a wonderful nap!
Amazing!
The water just happens to be very pure, I think.
The stream appears to originate from a mountainous region that...

While visiting one of the cities in your realm, you decide to go to a local tavern incognito. You happen to hear one man criticizing your rule. His arguments and solutions are interesting, though. Even more impressively, he isn’t terrified at all when you reveal yourself and threaten him with punishment.
An interesting man! I should bring him to my court.
He shall be arrested and taken to the local prison.
His ideas are good - I should recommend him to the mayor.
In one of the towns you visit, people are complaining about the local tax collector. They say he extorts more taxes than you require, and even keeps a small amount for himself.
What a terrible person! We should imprison him at once.
Why should I care? I’m still getting the taxes I want.

Today I visit one of my vassals, and we discuss various local issues affecting his domain, be it the ability of his levies, the amount of food his land can produce, the amount of trade that goes through, and so on.
Interesting. Can you tell me more about…

Your party comes across a traveling noble and his bodyguards. Oddly, the noble doesn’t seem to recognize you, perhaps because he appears to be a rather low-ranked one who has never met you. The road is small, and the fool insists that you move over to let him pass, saying, “Lesser men like you should defer to us!”
Very well, it’s no matter.
“Lesser”? How dare you address your superiors like that!
Imprison him for his insolence!
I just met a local patrol, who had just taken care of some highwaymen that had been terrorizing the nearby roads for weeks. As they dispose of the corpses, I congratulate them for their good work.
It is nice to see that my realm’s soldiers are competent.

Today I met one of the nobles of my realm, who was traveling on some personal business. As it so happened we decided to camp together for the night, as larger numbers would deter bandits. We discussed some of the happenings of the realm, as well as what we were doing.
Our conversation was very pleasant.
While traveling, I’ve been talking a lot with one of the lesser knights accompanying me. We donï¾’t agree on everything, but I’ve found our conversations fruitful and delightful.
You should come to my court and stay with me!
I’ve learned a lot about how my realm’s soldiers are doing.

We came across an old, abandoned mine today. Who knows how prosperous it was when it was still in operation centuries ago? Regardless, there wasnï¾’t much to see, but I did find a few valuable stones lying around.
I suppose these are worth a bit.

Wishing to understand how the peasants are doing, I talk to some in one of my realmï¾’s villages. Some are very scared, others polite and careful, yet others friendly and cordial (as if I were their friend!). One, however, told me of how his family recently suffered from a house fire and lost everything.
A sad tale. Hopefully you’ll survive!
I can offer a bit of gold to help.

You and your fellow travelers happen to meet with a small caravan of merchants. As it so happens, you both are headed to the same city. The merchants, seeing that you and your men are well-armed, request that you escort them to their destination. “The men we hired to protect us stole some of our goods and ran off,” they explain.
Very well, we will protect you.
No, I don’t have time. You’ll slow us down.
Help you? Why don’t we just take your goods instead!
Escort the merchants to the city nearby.

As you approach the city gates, the lead merchant tells you, “Thank you so much for protecting us. We can take care of ourselves from here. We don’t have much, but we wish to offer a few of our valuable merchandise in return for your kindness.”
Please keep that, you’ll need it more than me.
Thanks! It has been a pleasure.

You happen to come to one of your realm’s villages. The villagers report that a number of troublesome bandits have been raiding their village for some time, but the local authorities haven’t bothered to send any men, being busy with other matters. They beg for you to assist them.
I will send for a few of my soldiers as soon as I come home.
Why should I care about you dirty commoners?
I feel obligated to teach them how to defend themselves.
You spend some time teaching the villagers basic fighting techniques and military discipline.

Impressively, the newly raised militia learned a lot in a short time. Just as you finish a training session, the bandits come back and attack. Under your command the villagers defeat and kill many of them. You are very proud of the villagers - no longer will they live in fear!
Continue maintaining the militia, and you will do well.

One of the young men who fought in the militia was impressed with your leadership ability, and while he isnï¾’t of noble blood, wishes to serve under you. This man in particular was one of the more outstanding fighters during the battle against the bandits, slaying many.
Your village needs you more than me.
Good. You will bring your village much honor.

My men and I come across some bandits on the road, and handily defeat them. While inspecting their stolen goods, we find a young girl tied up. After freeing her, she says she is from a nearby town but was kidnapped - her family, though, was unable to pay the ransom. She begs for you to escort her to town.
I see. Let’s escort her back.
Men, leave us two alone. I want to have my way with this pretty thing.
She’ll be a burden, so I wish her good luck finding your way back.

As you prepare to have your way with the girl, against her wishes, one of your guards - who you know as a bold young man with a great sense of justice and virtue - pleads for you to stop and control yourself.
You’re right. I’m… ashamed. Let’s just escort her back.
How dare you question me? Begone and let me enjoy myself.
xxxxx
xxxxx
Reassert Power
With enough skill in the arts of intrigue and diplomacy you are able to free yourself from the title of Figurehead, as a result of this you may be able to exercise the use of more power.
With the passing of my predecessor the responsibility of the people of the Blackwater now falls onto my shoulders.
But I am only a figurehead...

You are awoken early in the morning by the sound of your door opening. Your Castellan announces himself and tells you of a disturbing rumor. There have been many reports of a hooded figure moving throughout the lower city in the dead of night. Some suspect this to the be the fabled 'Shadow of Duskendale,' Father of Damon Shadowborne.
I shall investigate these rumors...
It is but a story!
Right?

On the third night of your investigation you venture along the coast with a small retinue hoping to find the dreaded shadow. You see a lone figure hiding amongst a cloud of fog. Within an instant all of your men lie dead before you. "I shall have my vengeance!" The shadow yells. He approaches you, sword in hand...
I shall slay you as Damon did!
I cannot hope to defeat this demon! Flee!
He may catch you...

Your duel with the demon has entered its third hour. You look for any signs of weakness, but the phantom shows no sign of fatigue. You trip and fall as you attempt to dodge another onslaught of attacks. The demon raises his black sword for the killing blow.
Thrust your sword into the opening!

Your sword hits its mark, black blood spills from the wound and covers your face. The demon lets out a terrible scream "I shall return and have my final vengeance! For now you shall pay a price for my defeat" The shadow disappears into the fog... As you attempt to stand you fall unconscious.
A heavy price...

The Valyrian scourge have landed upon our shores. We at first attempted to treat with them, yet betrayal is second nature to those white haired, inbred, invaders. They sacked our ancestral seat, destroying hundreds of years worth of our history. We will not stand for this, we shall push them back into the sea and kill all that remain...
No mercy for those that deserve none.

The Archon has seen fit to send us to this curious land. Men that worship trees call themselves kings. We have taken the seat of the so called "Claw King", our conquest will continue. This land is fertile, and filled to the brim with fear...
I shall carve out a new Kingdom.

I am a fallen noble of the Valyrian Freehold. Ever since I killed Aegor Veltarys I have been judged for my actions. The Archon saw fit to send me here, a fate worse than death. This black rock will serve as my tomb...
Perhaps this is an opportunity?
Thenn
This character is a Thenn, known for their dislike of other cultures and for other cultures' dislike of them.
Thenn
Savage

The Thenns consider themselves the last of the First Men. The Thenns are savage fighters, but are more obedient and disciplined than other free folk. They are often better equipped than most free folk, with bronze helms, axes of bronze and a few of chipped stone, short stabbing spears with leaf-shaped heads, bronze swords, leather shirts sewn with bronze discs and scales, and plain unadorned shields of black boiled leather with bronze rims and bosses.
You are a proud and mighty Thenn!
Your times as a Thenn have come to an end as you embrace a foreign culture.
You are no longer a proud and mighty Thenn
While on patrol you see a figure in the distance, she sits atop a rock near the river cleaning her cloths. Her face and figure are perfect, and her bosom...
I must banish these thoughts!
I am her Lord, I'm sure she would like to know me.
After a pleasant chat you ask her if she needs help 'cleaning her clothes.' You spend the next few hours bathing in the warm water with the lady.
If only my wife were more like this woman!
After talking for a few hours you attempt to move your arm around the lady to comfort her, she quickly forces your hand away and scratches you before running away.
That wretch! Does she not know who I am!
Lesson learned
You run after her
After chasing the woman for a few minutes you corner her and force yourself on her. After you are finished with her you slit her throat so that none will ever know.
Good riddance I say!
You're a real piece of work
A bard has arrived at your capital requesting to perform a song about your exploits and accomplishments. No one at your court has ever heard a song by him before and are eager to hear his new tune.
Let him play
Be gone!

The song sways the hearts of your courtiers as it exposes and captures the inner meaning of your rule, by the end of the song the woman weep with joy and the men cheer with excitement for a possible encore.
A legendary tune!

At first the tune amuses the court and yourself, but it quickly devolves into a melody of disorganisation and folly. Nothing rhymes and most of the notes are out of tune. Any meaning is lost in the jumble of incoherent noise.
Absolutely terrible! Have him thrown out!
While on a patrol your horse becomes scared and bolts, to your horror the horse heads towards a cliff, you attempt to stop your horse but it is to late...
Ahhh!

You awake in bed surrounded by family and courtiers. Your survival is deemed to be the product of luck by those more cynical than most, however somehow you escaped without a single scratch on your body. Word of your miraculous survival spreads like wildfire throughout the realm, many see your survival as the product of divine intervention.
I'm alive!
You awake in bed surrounded by family and courtiers. Your leg aches with pain whenever you try to move it, many consider you lucky to even survive such a fall. Your horse was not as lucky.
That hurt.

Wind rushes past your face as you fall. You attempt to keep hold of your horse as you fall but you lose your grip on the bridle and are seperated from your mount. You close your eyes to seek your peace, the image of a lakeside with a dead tree manifests in your mind, but it quickly disapears as you open your eyes. The ground comes closer to kiss you...
Have mer- Argh!
It has been months since you last prayed to one of the seven aspects of the faith, perhaps it is time to offer patronage and pray to your prefered deity.
The Warrior give me strength...
May the Smith protect me in the coming days...
The Maid's purity is something worth worship...
As an outcast, I pray to the Stranger...
While walking along a road you encounter a sitting man, he possesses nothing, and all he wears is a worn robe.
Ignore the beggar
Give him a handful of Silver Stags

Once you drop the coins into the thin hands of the beggar he quickly stands upright. He slowly lifts his hood to reveal an aged and stern face with a long white beard. He speaks slowly and deliberately with a tone most soothing, he has seen fit to bless you for your charity. With that he slowly walks away into the woods, never to be seen by you again.
Who was that?
It's the Father!
The Kingdom of Rune and Mountain is a barbaric title once ruled by the Bronze Kings of old. Should we allow this title which once venerated savagery to exist in the realm?
Destroy this barbaric title
It was a different time, the title may exist now
The Kings of the Blackwood Vale were an ancient line of exiles. Perhaps it is time to destroy this ancient title and usher in a new era for the region under our direct control?
Destroy this barbaric title
Mayhaps this title will serve me well, leave it for now

Long have the Storm Kings followed the wisdom of the Old Gods, through their guidance we have created a vast and prosperous Kingdom. Yet to the north the Andal threat cannot be ignored. I married the daughter of an Andal warlord thinking that it would stop the spread of that damned pointed star, but I was wrong. Now my son, half Andal, has married the Andal Princess of Tarth. Most of my vassals in the north have also embraced this foreign religion and renouced the old ways that saw us through every crisis. I must now decide, should I convert to the new faith and appease my northern lords? Or strive to renew the worship of the Old Gods?
I shall convert, it is the prudent decision
I care not for this foreign faith

My son has committed a folly of which has no precedent. He foolishly thought himself a master of a craft he possesses no talent in. To solve the Royce issue which has plagued my reign for so long he invited the Royces to a feast to seek a lasting peace. However they were mistaken in my sons intentions and many of them were slain and tried for treason. Most were caught and murdered by my sons hand, but a few escaped and brought news of the massacre to Runestone. Now I am left to clean the up the mess of my son and bring the lords to heel. Once the war is won I will deal with Roland...
Madness, madness and stupidity

The Andal conquest to the South seems unstoppable but in the North the First Men stand strong ever still. Though recently an Andal warlord named Argos shored off the eastern coast of the North occupying terretories of the Red King Rogar ''the Huntsman“ who swore fealty to you in exchange for military support.

The Andal conquest to the South seems unstoppable but in the North the First Men stand strong ever still. Though recently an Andal warlord named Argos shored off the eastern coast of the North occupying some of your terretories. In order to prevent future aggression by this warlord you have sworen fealty to the King of Winter Theon Stark in exchange for military support.
The North must stay strong!

With the conquest of this small piece of land I have started the conquest of the northern kingdoms. However, the king I have taken these lands from, Rogar Bolton, has managed to ally himself with the so-called Winter King Theon Stark whom they call the Hungry Wolf. They will not prevail against our armie of zealouts and battle hardened warriors. We will bring the gods to this faithless land.
They will kneel!
True Knight

I have managed to establish a Valyrian foothold on this continent, the population and influence of my colony grows every day. A message has arrived from the Archon, apparently he is showing an interest in incorporating my lands into his domain.
